children.text: Setup the scene by adjusting a few general physics properties, like the stepping mode and the amount of iterations it will perform.
Setup the ball physics by updating its last position, preventing weird shapes on its trail.
Setup the ball graphics by adding it as a child of the ball physics, making them stick together.

events.text: The cinematic effects are disabled by default, because they're only useful when recording footage, otherwise they can make the game very hard to play.

children.text: Constantly scroll the camera towards the player position, but using lerp for interpolating the values, resulting in a smoother camera motion.
Zoom the camera by changing the layout scale, which is set based on a tween animation.
If any of the input keys/buttons for the activating the left flipper are pressed, created a flipper collision object and make it disappear quickly, so it's not too easy to hit a ball.
If any of the input keys/buttons for the activating the right flipper are pressed, created a flipper collision object and make it disappear quickly, so it's not too easy to hit a ball.
If a ball collides with a flipper, disable the collision, so it doesn't affect the ball more than once, then apply impulse to the ball, so it can be thrown up.
When the ball collides with the shooter, thrown it up with slightly random force and spawn a few particles on the shooter's tip.

If the ball collide with any of the slingshot objects and the slingshot is able to bounce the ball (out of the cooldown timer), apply force to it depending on the slingshot's conditions, which are different for each one of them.

In most cases a family would be useful for reducing similar code for objects with similar purposes, but since most of the slingshots have very distinct methods for applying impulse, having separate event was the best option.
Only if the ball is on a specific side in comparison with the slingshot.
Only if the ball is on a specific side in comparison with the slingshot.
Only if the ball is on a specific side in comparison with the slingshot.
Only if the ball is on a specific side in comparison with the slingshot.
Apply force to a specific ball based on a pre-defined angle.
Also display an animated fake score text (optional).
Once the score text has finished it's initial knockback animation, destroy it by making it disappear.
Start a cooldown timer on a specific slingshot, which will prevent it from applying force to a ball temporarily.

actions.text: Also flash the slingshot, so the player knows it has been hit.

children.text: Once the cooldown is over, allow the slingshot to bounce balls again.
Setup the lights by creating an outline behind each one of them.
If a ball collides with a light, make the light blink by changing its color in a ping pong animation.
If a ball collides with a hole entrance, disable the physics behavior, so the ball stops moving. Also snap the ball's position to match the hole position.
Once the ball has been properly positionated, make it disappear by slowly reducing its opacity to zero.
Once the ball is completely invisible, change its position and increase its opacity again.
Once the ball is visible again, throw it in a random direction.
Create a trail effect behind the ball.

actions.text: Adjust the trail angle to point towards the ball.
Adjust the trail width to reach the ball's last position.

children.text: Update and store the ball's last position.
Shoot a small thunder out of the ball every 1/4 of a second, towards a random direction.

actions.text: Also spawn a few sparkles where the thunder hits for a more impactful effect. The sparkles position is based on the hit position and the sparkles angle is based on the hit object normal angle.

children.text: Flash each background every few seconds, to simulate the light of a thunder during a storm.
Constantly offset the texture on the walls and on the background, so the environment feel more alive, even when the ball is not moving so much.
For the game to be restarted, for testing purposes only.
Restart the game if a ball falls through the hole on the bottom.
